screen_name: It’s been a good 7 weeks from being free from my hospital bed - yet still I’m aware of some lung restriction. I’m pretty much back to normal, but more tired than normal. I also find horrendous problems with my memory and processing sometimes. I’ll go for a check after lockdown.

I’m currently day 3 in hospital having tested positive for Coronavirus. Also pneumonia and diabetic ketoacisidosis! Felt like death when blue lighted to QE in B’ham, but now regaining strength and feeling more positive. I absolutely love our NHS. Even typing that makes me cry.

So we’re encouraged not to shake hands with clients or be within a metre of people and to keep washing our hands. 

Yet we’re ok with court security guards still grappling with us? I appreciate they’ve got a job to do, but the quicker we get ID cards sorted, the better please!
